dcterms:description: The Daily Trade and Quote (TAQ) dataset covers all stocks traded in the US market, focusing on the components of the S&P 500 for computing liquidity-driven variables such as average bid-ask spread, traded value, volatility, and average book size.
dcterms:title: Daily Trade and Quote (TAQ) dataset

dcterms:description: Bloomberg News data is used for sentiment analysis, where news articles are evaluated based on their sentiment scores indicating bullish, bearish, or neutral views.
dcterms:title: Bloomberg News data

dcterms:description: The Harvard-IV psychosocial dictionary is utilized for estimating the sentiment of news articles, particularly in the context of financial news.
dcterms:title: Harvard-IV psychosocial dictionary

dcterms:description: Reuters NewsScope provides news data concerning stocks, which is used to analyze the impact of news on stock prices and liquidity.
dcterms:title: Reuters NewsScope

dcterms:description: The S&P 500 components dataset focuses on the stocks included in the S&P 500 index, which are analyzed for their market behavior in relation to news events.
dcterms:title: S&P 500 components

dcterms:creator: N. Oliveira
P. Cortez
N. Areal
dcterms:description: Sentiment lexicons based on microblogging data are developed to capture stock market sentiment, which is used for sentiment analysis in financial contexts.
dcterms:title: Sentiment lexicons based on microblogging data

dcterms:description: News data concerning 40 stocks actively traded at the London Stock Exchange is used to analyze liquidity mode fitting and its impact on stock prices.
dcterms:title: News data concerning 40 stocks at the London Stock Exchange
